column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////We settled on each getting a lunch special--a personal pizza with a small salad. The special meant the pizzas only took about 15 minutes to make as opposed to the normal 35 minutes. Our salads came out
column2: and they were exactly what you'd expect from a pizza place. Nothing special
column3: but at least they were something to eat. The pizza eventually came out
column4: and they only cut it one direction
column5: so I had to wrestle with it to cut normal sized pieces. It was okay--the crust good
column6: but some seemed underdone. It was very filling--no need for anything more than a personal. My dad's pepperoni was better than my plain.
